description: This notification is sent when Netway Manager receives active alarms from the SNMP enabled devices.
This includes all information pertaining to each active alarm
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmNew NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmNWMId i 9999 NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmManagedObjectClass s EXAMPLE NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmManagedObjectInstance s EXAMPLE NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmId i 9999 NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmAgentIPAddress s EXAMPLE NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmDeviceType i 0 NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmDeviceId s EXAMPLE NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmDeviceName s EXAMPLE NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmSeverity i 1 NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmArrivedDateandTime s EXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPL NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmOccuredDateandTime s EXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPL NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmDescription s EXAMPLE NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmRemedy s EXAMPLE

description: This object uniquely identifies an entry in the Netway Manager local database.
The alarmId object is read-only even though it is used as index in the Netway Manager Alarm Table.
Alternatively, set of [alarmId + alarmDeviceId + alarmDescription] can be used at NMS
to uniquely identify & correlate with the existing alarms
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmNWMId

description: A name identifying a Managed Object Class. This object identifies the class of network
resources to which the subject alarm is related. This will be Powerwave for all devices managed by Netway Manager.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmManagedObjectClass

description: A distinguished name identifying a Managed Object Instance
through a containment hierarchy within the name space of Netway Manager.
It is important that this name is consistent with
naming used over other interfaces, such as interfaces for
configuration and performance management.
This object identifies the instance (of a class) of
network resource to which the subject alarm is related.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmManagedObjectInstance

description: This object uniquely identifies an entry in the
original device Alarm Table.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmId

description: This object represents the IP Address of the original agent device from which the alarm has received.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmAgentIPAddress

description: This object represents the type of the device.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmDeviceType

description: This object represents the unique device ID identified at the original device. For Example: Serial Number.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmDeviceId

description: This object represents the unique device ID identified at the Netway Manager.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmDeviceName

description: This object represents the severity level of the alarm.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmSeverity

description: This object represents the alarm arrived date and time at the Netway Manager. Time is in milliseconds.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmArrivedDateandTime

description: This object represents the alarm occured date and time at the device. Time is in milliseconds.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmOccuredDateandTime

description: This object represents the customized alarm description identified by the Netway Manager.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmDescription

description: This object represents the alarm remedy identified by the Netway Manager.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmRemedy

description: This notification is sent when Netway Manager receives any clear alarm from the enabled devices.
This includes all information pertaining to each clear alarm.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmCleared NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmNWMId i 9999 NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmId i 9999 NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmAgentIPAddress s EXAMPLE NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmDeviceType i 0 NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmDeviceId s EXAMPLE NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmDeviceName s EXAMPLE NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmClearedDateandTime s EXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPL

description: This object uniquely identifies an entry in the Netway Manager local database.
The alarmId object is read-only even though it is used as index in the Netway Manager Alarm Table.
Alternatively, set of [alarmId + alarmDeviceId + alarmDescription] can be used at NMS
to uniquely identify & correlate with the existing alarms
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmNWMId

description: This object uniquely identifies an entry in the
original device Alarm Table.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmId

description: This object represents the IP Address of the original agent device from which the alarm has received.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmAgentIPAddress

description: This object represents the type of the device.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmDeviceType

description: This object represents the unique device ID identified at the original device. For Example: Serial Number.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmDeviceId

description: This object represents the unique device ID identified at the Netway Manager.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmDeviceName

description: This object represents the alarm cleared date and time at the device. Time is in milliseconds.
When the alarm is cooperatively cleared either by NetWay or NMS, this object represents
the time the alarm is cleared by either NetWay or NMS
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmClearedDateandTime

description: This notification is always used by NetWay to send active alarm traps to cooperative NMSs.
This includes all information pertaining to each active alarm including ack state
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmCooperativeNew NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmNWMId i 9999 NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmManagedObjectClass s EXAMPLE NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmManagedObjectInstance s EXAMPLE NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmId i 9999 NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmAgentIPAddress s EXAMPLE NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmDeviceType i 0 NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmDeviceId s EXAMPLE NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmDeviceName s EXAMPLE NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmSeverity i 1 NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmArrivedDateandTime s EXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPL NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmOccuredDateandTime s EXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPL NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmDescription s EXAMPLE NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmRemedy s EXAMPLE NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmAckState i 1 NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmAckDateandTime s EXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPL

original device Alarm Table.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmId

description: This object represents the IP Address of the original agent device from which the alarm has received.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmAgentIPAddress

description: This object represents the type of the device.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmDeviceType

description: This object represents the unique device ID identified at the original device. For Example: Serial Number.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmDeviceId

description: This object represents the unique device ID identified at the Netway Manager.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmDeviceName

description: This object represents the severity level of the alarm.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmSeverity

description: This object represents the alarm arrived date and time at the Netway Manager. Time is in milliseconds.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmArrivedDateandTime

description: This object represents the alarm occured date and time at the device. Time is in milliseconds.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmOccuredDateandTime

description: This object represents the customized alarm description identified by the Netway Manager.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmDescription

description: This object represents the alarm remedy identified by the Netway Manager.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmRemedy

description: This object represents the acknowledgement state of the alarm.
This object is used when the alarm is cooperatively acknowledged/unacknowledged
between NetWay & NMS
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmAckState

description: This object represents the acknowledgement date and time of the alarm. Time is in milliseconds.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmAckDateandTime

description: This notification is sent to cooperative NMSs when Netway Manager receives any clear alarm from the enabled devices
and also used when an alarm is cooperatively cleared between NetWay & NMS. This includes all information pertaining
to each clear alarm.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmCooperativeCleared NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmNWMId i 9999 NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmId i 9999 NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmAgentIPAddress s EXAMPLE NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmDeviceType i 0 NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmDeviceId s EXAMPLE NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmDeviceName s EXAMPLE NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmClearedDateandTime s EXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPL NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmDescription s EXAMPLE

Alternatively, set of [alarmId + alarmDeviceId + alarmDescription] can be used at NMS
to uniquely identify & correlate with the existing alarms

variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmClearedDateandTime

description: This object represents the customized alarm description identified by the Netway Manager.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmDescription

description: This notification is used when the alarm is cooperatively acknowledged or unacknowledged between the NetWay & NMS
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmCooperativeAcknowledgement NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmNWMId i 9999 NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmId i 9999 NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmAgentIPAddress s EXAMPLE NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmDeviceType i 0 NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmDeviceId s EXAMPLE NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmDeviceName s EXAMPLE NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmAckState i 1 NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmAckDateandTime s EXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPL NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmDescription s EXAMPLE

description: This object uniquely identifies an entry in the Netway Manager local database.
The alarmId object is read-only even though it is used as index in the Netway Manager Alarm Table.
Alternatively, set of [alarmId + alarmDeviceId + alarmDescription] can be used at NMS
to uniquely identify & correlate with the existing alarms
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmNWMId

description: This object uniquely identifies an entry in the
original device Alarm Table.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmId

description: This object represents the IP Address of the original agent device from which the alarm has received.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmAgentIPAddress

description: This object represents the type of the device.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmDeviceType

description: This object represents the unique device ID identified at the original device. For Example: Serial Number.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmDeviceId

description: This object represents the unique device ID identified at the Netway Manager.

This object is used when the alarm is cooperatively acknowledged/unacknowledged

description: This object represents the acknowledgement date and time of the alarm. Time is in milliseconds.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmAckDateandTime

description: This object represents the customized alarm description identified by the Netway Manager.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmDescription

description: This notification is sent to Netway from a cooperative NMS for alarm synchronization(NMS initiated).
NMS uses this to synchronize Network wide alarm information with NetWay. alarmSyncRequestId generated by
cooperative NMS will be in the range of 1 - 5000. alarmAgentIPAddress will be the cooperative NMS's IP
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmSyncRequest NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmSyncRequestId i 9999 NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmAgentIPAddress s EXAMPLE

description: This object represents the unique request number sent as part of alarm synchronization
request by the originating cooperative NMS. [alarmSyncRequestId + alarmAgentIPAddress]
is unique at NetWay. Cooperative NMS uses the range 1 - 5000 for alarmSyncRequestId in
alarmSyncRequest. For NetWay initiated alarm synchronization, NetWay will use the range
5001 - 10000 for alarmSyncRequestId in alarmSyncResponse.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmSyncRequestId

description: This object represents the IP Address of the original agent device from which the alarm has received.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmAgentIPAddress

description: This response notification is sent from NetWay to cooperative NMS indicating the alarm synchronization state.
For NetWay initiated alarm synchronization, alarmSyncRequestId generated by NetWay will be in the range of 5001 - 10000.
For NetWay initiated alarm synchronization, alarmDeviceIdList would be the sequence of device ids, separated by comma
on which NetWay initiated alarm synchronization. For NMS initiated alarm synchronization, alarmDeviceIdList would be the
sequence of the device ids that make the originating NMS's network

event.Summary: Alarm synchronization response: $v2 of request $v1 received

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmSyncResponse NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmSyncRequestId i 9999 NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmSyncState i 1 NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmDeviceIdList s EXAMPLE

description: This object represents the unique request number sent as part of alarm synchronization
request by the originating cooperative NMS. [alarmSyncRequestId + alarmAgentIPAddress]
is unique at NetWay. Cooperative NMS uses the range 1 - 5000 for alarmSyncRequestId in
alarmSyncRequest. For NetWay initiated alarm synchronization, NetWay will use the range
5001 - 10000 for alarmSyncRequestId in alarmSyncResponse.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmSyncRequestId

description: This object will be part of the alarm synchronization response from NetWay to the cooperative NMSs
indicating the state of the alarm synchronization. This would also be used to indicate any error condition.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmSyncState

description: This object is sequence of device ids (serial numbers) separated by comma. Used in alarmSyncResponse
notification.
variables.name: NWM-ALARM-MIB-V2::alarmDeviceIdList
